intro: Pilocarpus spicatus, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers and smooth, dark green leaves. The plant produces small, red, fleshy fruits that contain seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens but can become invasive in certain regions.
